title: How to Make Sugar Cookie Rice Krispie Treats

steps.headline: Melt the butter in a large saucepan.
steps.description: Over a low heat setting, melt the butter to where it is nearly all liquid.

steps.headline: Add the marshmallows.
steps.description: Combine and stir the butter and marshmallows until everything is melted thoroughly. Remove the pan from the heat and add the sugar cookie mix and salt.

steps.headline: Add and fold in the cereal.
steps.description: As you stir, it may become a challenge to get the cereal coated.

parts.name: Setting and Cutting the Rice Krispies Treats

steps.headline: Set the Rice Krispies.
steps.description: Spread the mixture in a 9"x13" (23 x 33 cm) greased baking dish. Use a greased spatula to quickly evenly spread it around.

steps.headline: Cut the treats into squares.
steps.description: Use a sharp, clean knife to cut them into even squares.

steps.headline: Form them into "cookies".
steps.description: Cup your hands and gently round the edges of each square into a circle.

steps.headline: Make the frosting.
steps.description: Beat the ingredients with a hand or stand mixer. Drop a drop or two of food coloring in, if you wish to have color on your treats.

steps.headline: Spread the frosting over the Rice Krispies.
steps.description: Use a spatula or the back of a spoon to evenly spread it around.

steps.headline: Garnish the Rice Krispies.
steps.description: Use the sprinkles and evenly sprinkle them around.

text: Making the Rice Krispies Treats Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Over a low heat setting, melt the butter to where it is nearly all liquid. Add the marshmallows. Combine and stir the butter and marshmallows until everything is melted thoroughly. Remove the pan from the heat and add the sugar cookie mix and salt. Add and fold in the cereal. As you stir, it may become a challenge to get the cereal coated. Setting and Cutting the Rice Krispies Treats Set the Rice Krispies. Spread the mixture in a 9"x13" (23 x 33 cm) greased baking dish. Use a greased spatula to quickly evenly spread it around. Cut the treats into squares. Use a sharp, clean knife to cut them into even squares. Form them into "cookies". Cup your hands and gently round the edges of each square into a circle. Make the frosting. Beat the ingredients with a hand or stand mixer. Drop a drop or two of food coloring in, if you wish to have color on your treats. Spread the frosting over the Rice Krispies. Use a spatula or the back of a spoon to evenly spread it around. Garnish the Rice Krispies. Use the sprinkles and evenly sprinkle them around. Finished.
